author: TJ Jarrett
text: When we gathered at the house, while the men all looked at their shoes and the women whispered,

she sat down with a fist full of paper napkins and folded them into birds. When she filled her hands, she crossed the room to the hearth and threw a bird into the flames, then another, then another until she had destroyed all she created. Years later when I asked her what she meant, she couldn’t remember.
title: At the Repast
